answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.There are few conditions in which urine testing may not be much helpful like if the urine tested was not in your bladder for at least 4 hours before collecting the test sample. Home test kits are not 100% accurate. They may help in detecting the presence of a UTI but  can't provide information about the location of the infection. It is best to consult a doctor before using any kit. It is best to consult a doctor and discuss your concerns. Hope it really helps. Do keep us posted.Take care and regards!

question: I have type 2 diabetes and am prone to UTI's so I test my urine a few times a week.  How accurate are the home testing strips?  I've had every symptom of a UTI and tested negative.  I've also tested positive, gone to the doctor, and his testing showed no infection.  I follow the directions to the letter, use unexpired strips, and store them according to directions.
title: How accurate is self testing for UTI's?
